alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 20 at 3:23AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility and Slippery Surfaces... Fog was beginning to develop across portions of the Hi-Line early this morning, generally across Hill, Blaine, Chouteau, and Cascade Counties. Some areas may see locally dense fog, especially low- lying areas, which could reduce visibility to near one quarter of a mile. Additionally, with temperatures well below freezing, roads surfaces like bridges and overpasses may become slippery and hazardous. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing conditions over short distances. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra spacing between vehicles if driving through fog.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County
